intro: Cryptantha jamesii var. setosa, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky slopes. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. The species is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils and can survive in harsh desert climates.
